/* Entering World War II */ the entity that controled the east indies
/* Last days of the war */ does not fit in this section
/* Early reign */ This is repeat of intro, and without cites to emperor involvement
/* Early reign */ This is characterization of details provided in next paragraph
/* Early life */ this really should be a separate section since it spans early life and his reign
This is event summary. Details of involvement are in article with cites.
The paragraph is a summary, principally about events. The article talks in detail about his involvement and gives cites.
/* Early reign */ "any real" presumes that there was real civilian control of the military, which is widely disputed.
/* Death and state funeral */ its been months, and since these claims have no source, I'm removing. The duodenal cancer one urks me.

It may or may not be the case, but it is certainly not common sense. You need to [[WP:V|cite]] it or remove it. That is how Wikipedia works. An uncited style guide is non-verifiable.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision by [[Special:Contributions/58.88.55.173|58.88.55.173]] ([[User talk:58.88.55.173|talk]]) - a little common sense -- especially on the first tag -- would go a long way.
Needs real citations. Wikipedia style guide is not a [[WP:V|reliable source]].
moved [[Emperor ShÅwa]] to [[Hirohito]] over redirect: revert - what part of "common use" is giving you problems? Is it "common"? Or is it "use"?
moved [[Hirohito]] to [[Emperor ShÅwa]] over redirect: Try to explain me why this name is more pedantic than [[Emperor Meiji]] or [[Pope Benedict XVI]]?
moved [[Emperor ShÅwa]] to [[Hirohito]] over redirect: revert to actually used name, rather than pedantic -- probably wrong -- ruleslawyering name
moved [[Hirohito]] to [[Emperor ShÅwa]] over redirect: Revert. Wikipedia's policy is to use the most proper name, the name most in accordance with the encyclopedia's consistency.
moved [[Emperor ShÅwa]] to [[Hirohito]] over redirect: rv move - wikipedia policy is to use most common english name, and Showa is basically unheard of in english literature
moved [[Hirohito]] to [[Emperor ShÅwa]] over redirect: Proper title
